com.github.kennedyoliveira.pastebin4j

Class PasteBin

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.kennedyoliveira.pastebin4j.PasteBin

  • public class PasteBin
extends java.lang.Object

    Core class to interact with the PasteBin API.

    All the interactions can be made by this class.

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PasteBin(AccountCredentials accountCredentials)
      Creates a new PasteBin object for interacting with PasteBin API.
      PasteBin(AccountCredentials accountCredentials, PasteBinApi pasteBinApi)
      Creates a new PasteBin object for interacting with PasteBin API, using a custom implementation for the API.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PasteBin

        public PasteBin(@NotNull
                AccountCredentials accountCredentials)
        Creates a new PasteBin object for interacting with PasteBin API.
        Parameters:
        accountCredentials - Credentials for acessing the API.

      • PasteBin

        public PasteBin(@NotNull
                AccountCredentials accountCredentials,
                @NotNull
                PasteBinApi pasteBinApi)
        Creates a new PasteBin object for interacting with PasteBin API, using a custom implementation for the API.
        Parameters:
        accountCredentials - Credentials for acessing the API.
        pasteBinApi - The custom implemenation for the API, it can't be null.

    • Method Detail

      • getAccountCredentials

        public AccountCredentials getAccountCredentials()
        Returns:
        The account credentials currently used.

      • getUserInformation

        public java.util.Optional<UserInformation> getUserInformation()

        The user information

        This information will be available only after you call fetchUserInformation() or any method that need the userInformation for interacting with the api, for example:

        createPaste(Paste), listUserPastes()

        Note: The UserInformation just will be fetched if AccountCredentials.userName and AccountCredentials.password are valids.

        Returns:
        The user information

      • fetchUserInformation

        public UserInformation fetchUserInformation()

        Fetch the user information using the AccountCredentials.userName and AccountCredentials.password.

        After this method is called and returned with success you can acess the userInformation calling the method getUserInformation()

        Returns:
        the user information.

      • createPaste

        public java.lang.String createPaste(@NotNull
                                    Paste paste)

        Creates a new Paste and return the link to the created paste.

        To make easy to create pastes, you can you se Paste.newBuilder().

        Parameters:
        paste - The paste to be created.
        Returns:
        The link for the created paste.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the paste is null or Paste.content is null.

      • listUserPastes

        @NotNull
public java.util.List<Paste> listUserPastes()

        List 50 user pastes.

        To list more than 50 you can use the method listUserPastes(int) and pass the limit up to 1000 pastes.

        Returns:
        A list of pastes.

      • listUserPastes

        @NotNull
public java.util.List<Paste> listUserPastes(int limit)

        List pastes up to the number especified in the limit parameter.

        Parameters:
        limit - Maximum pastes to list.
        Returns:
        A list of pastes.

      • deletePaste

        public boolean deletePaste(@NotNull
                           Paste paste)

        Delete a paste

        The current implementation uses the Paste.key to delete.

        Parameters:
        paste - Paste to be deleted.
        Returns:
        True if it was deleted, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the paste or Paste.key is null

      • listTrendingPastes

        public java.util.List<Paste> listTrendingPastes()
        Returns:
        List the trending pastes.

      • getPasteContent

        public java.lang.String getPasteContent(@NotNull
                                        Paste paste)

        Fetchs the content of a paste.

        The currently implementation only fetchs content of pastes PasteVisibility.PUBLIC or PasteVisibility.UNLISTED.

        Parameters:
        paste - Paste to have the contents fetched.
        Returns:
        The content of the paste.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the paste is null or if Paste.visibility is PasteVisibility.PRIVATE
